IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDES LEADERSHIP AND RAISES FUNDS TO HELP ORGANIZATIONS PRESERVE MONTANA'S HERITAGE RESOURCES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: PROVIDE DEVELOPMENT AND ADVISORY LEADERSHIP FOR ORGANIZATIONS DEDICATED TO THE PRESERVATION OF MONTANA'S HISTORY AND CULTURE.
IRS990.Desc: FUND RAISING AND GRANTING OF AWARDS TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE MONTANA HISTORY THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUPPORT MONTANA HERITAGE COMMISSION OPERATIONS AND PROJECTS INCLUDING THE PIONEER FUND, VIRGINIA CITY/NEVADA CITY PROJECTS, AND THE RESTORATION OF STONEWALL HALL.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: EXPENDITURES TO SUPPORT OTHER MONTANA HISTORICAL PROJECTS

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART II, SECTION B, LINE 10 OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT FEES WERE MOVED FROM LINE 10 TO LINE 12 AS THIS REVENUE IS RELATED TO AN EXEMPT FUNCTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT ASSETS ARE INVESTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH SOUND INVESTMENT PRACTICES THAT EMPHASIZE LONG-TERM INVESTMENT FUNDAMENTALS. THE INVESTMENT OBJECTIVE FOR THE PORTFOLIO ASSETS IS TO MAINTAIN A LEVEL OF CURRENT INCOME AND TO MEET WITHDRAWAL NEEDS WITH ANY SHORTFALL TO BE MADE UP FROM NET CAPITAL APPRECIATION. MHF HAS IMPLEMENTED A SPENDING POLICY THAT INDICATES THE ENDOWMENT INVESTMENT EARNINGS ARE TO BE SPENT TO SUPPORT PROGRAMS IT HAS IDENTIFIED WITHIN ITS VARIOUS MISSIONS.
MHF IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. AS A RESULT, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAX IS INCLUDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
SCRIVER CENTER EXPENSE NETTED AGAINST RENTAL INCOME ON FORM 990 55,869.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE GIFT ANNUITIES 47,964.
SCRIVER CENTER EXPENSE NETTED AGAINST RENTAL INCOME ON FORM 990 55,869.
CORRECTION OF ERRORS WERE MADE IN THE CURRENT YEAR TO CORRECT THE BALANCE IN THE ENDOWMENT FUND. THESE CORRECTIONS ARE REFLECTED IN LINES 1B, 1C AND 1E.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE GIFT ANNUITIES
POSTCARD COLLECTION USED TO PRESERVE AND PROMOTE THE HISTORY OF THE STATE OF MONTANA, OIL AND GAS LEASES, AND BRONZE CASTING RIGHTS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THOMPSON-HICKMAN MADISON COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY AND ARCHIVES
MINERAL COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY AND MUSEUM

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED BASED ON WRITTEN REQUESTS OUTLINING PROJECT DETAILS, GOALS, AND COSTS. MONTANA HISTORY FOUNDATION BOARD APPROVAL IS REQUIRED FOR LARGE GRANTS. GRANTEES ARE ASKED TO PROVIDE REPORTS AT PROJECT COMLETION AND INVITED TO GIVE PRESENTATIONS AT BOARD MEETINGS.
THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS IS REPORTED IN PART 1

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WAS PROVIDED TO THE MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY WHOSE QUESTIONS WERE REVIEWED AND ANSWERED. AFTER ALL QUESTIONS WERE ANSWERED THE BOARD APPROVED THE FORM 990 FOR FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO READ, SIGN AND RETURN TO THE FOUNDATION THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ANNUALLY. EACH BOARD AND COMMITTEE MEETING BEGINS WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE ANNOUNCEMENT DURING ROLL CALL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE PRESIDENT/CEO'S PERFORMANCE AND COMPENSATION ANNUALLY AND PRESENTS A RECOMMENDATION TO THE FULL GOVERNING BODY FOR APPROVAL AS PART OF THE ANNUAL BUDGETING PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S TAX FORMS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS
THE PROCEDURE FOR REVIEWING THE AUDIT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEARS.
